channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Biden awards Pope Francis the Presidential Medal of Freedom with distinction
item.description: The White House commended Pope Francis for his commitment to serving the poor, as well as advocating for peace and protecting the planet.
item.content:encoded:
The White House commended Pope Francis for his commitment to serving the poor, as well as advocating for peace and protecting the planet.

(Image credit: Alessandra Tarantino)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: USDA report finds Boar's Head listeria outbreak was due to poor sanitation practices
item.description: A report released by the Department of Agriculture found that poor sanitation practices at a Boar's Head facility in Virginia contributed to the largest listeria outbreak since 2011.
item.content:encoded:
A report released by the Department of Agriculture found that poor sanitation practices at a Boar's Head facility in Virginia contributed to the largest listeria outbreak since 2011. 

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Clare Marie Schneider

item.title: Firefighters make progress on LA blazes, and alert system is changed
item.description: Firefighters made progress overnight on almost all of the active fires, including the massive Palisades and Eaton blazes, officials said.
item.content:encoded:
Firefighters made progress overnight on almost all of the active fires, including the massive Palisades and Eaton blazes, officials said.

(Image credit: Lokman Vural Elibol)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: A winter storm wraps up in the South, with travel delays and power outages persisting
item.description: The significant winter storm had passed in the South by Saturday morning, but travel issues and power outages were still ongoing.
item.content:encoded:
The significant winter storm had passed in the South by Saturday morning, but travel issues and power outages were still ongoing.

(Image credit: Megan Varner)
item.dc:creator: Clare Marie Schneider

item.title: As fires in Los Angeles rage, an already-hurting Hollywood presses pause
item.description: The fires around Los Angeles arrived just as Hollywood's awards season kicked off. It's an ominous sign at a time when film and TV production is already down.
item.content:encoded:
The fires around Los Angeles arrived just as Hollywood's awards season kicked off. It's an ominous sign at a time when film and TV production is already down.

(Image credit: Patrick T. Fallon)
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: Why are so many indigenous Panamanians contracting HIV — and dying of AIDS?
item.description: The government provides HIV medicines free of charge. Yet in one indigenous territory, cases and deaths are increasing at an alarming rate.
item.content:encoded:
The government provides HIV medicines free of charge. Yet in one indigenous territory, cases and deaths are increasing at an alarming rate.

(Image credit: Adam Williams for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Adam Williams

item.title: In a bitter fight for the Minnesota Legislature, Democrats have threatened a walkout
item.description: A series of unexpected events after the narrow election has set up a power struggle in the Minnesota Legislature. Days before the legislative session kicks off, it's unclear who will take control.
item.content:encoded:
A series of unexpected events after the narrow election has set up a power struggle in the Minnesota Legislature. Days before the legislative session kicks off, it's unclear who will take control.

(Image credit: Clay Masters)
item.dc:creator: Dana Ferguson

item.title: Photos: Southern California residents return to devastation as two major wildfires rage on
item.description: More than 100,000 Los Angeles County residents remain under evacuation orders, and the threat of fire there is not over. New evacuations were ordered last night and strong Santa Ana winds are expected to pick up again today.
item.content:encoded:
More than 100,000 Los Angeles County residents remain under evacuation orders, and the threat of fire there is not over. New evacuations were ordered last night and strong Santa Ana winds are expected to pick up again today.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Mhari Shaw

item.title: Bomb threats shadowed international reporters who covered Chinese celebrity dissident
item.description: Reporters covering a Chinese dissident in Europe were accused of making bomb threats. An NPR investigation now has them wondering if it was the work of the Chinese government or someone else.
item.content:encoded:
Reporters covering a Chinese dissident in Europe were accused of making bomb threats. An NPR investigation now has them wondering if it was the work of the Chinese government or someone else.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: Opinion: When Jimmy Carter and I spoke about UFOs
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon recalls a conversation he once had with the late President Jimmy Carter about the possibility of UFOs.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Scott Simon recalls a conversation he once had with the late President Jimmy Carter about the possibility of UFOs.

(Image credit: Charles Tasnadi)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon
